data.enText: to cut sth into pieces with a sharp tool such as a knife
Chop the carrots up into small pieces.
Add the finely chopped onions.
He was chopping logs for firewood.

data.chText: 这个国家被划分为若干小的行政区。
data.enText: The country was chopped up into small administrative areas.

data.chText: （大幅度地）削减，降低；取消；终止
data.enText: to reduce sth by a large amount; to stop sth

data.chText: 股价由每股50便士猛降至20便士。
data.enText: The share price was chopped from 50 pence to 20 pence.
to hit sb/sth with a short downward stroke or blow
chop and change
to keep changing your mind or what you are doing
chop (away) at sth
to aim blows at sth with a heavy sharp tool such as an axe
chop sth↔down
to make sth, such as a tree, fall by cutting it at the base with a sharp tool
chop sth↔off (sth)
to remove sth by cutting it with a sharp tool

data.chText: 他从那棵树上砍下一根树枝。
data.enText: He chopped a branch off the tree.
Anne Boleyn had her head chopped off.
a thick slice of meat with a bone attached to it, especially from a pig or sheep
a pork/lamb chop
an act of cutting sth with a quick downward movement using an axe or a knife
an act of hitting sb/sth with the side of your hand in a quick downward movement
a karate chop
the part of a person's or an animal's face around the mouth
The dog sat licking its chops.
get/be given the chop
to be dismissed from a job

data.chText: 整个部门的员工都已被解雇。
data.enText: The whole department has been given the chop.
to be stopped or ended

data.chText: 又有三个方案遭斧削了。
data.enText: Three more schemes have got the chop.
be for the chop
to be likely to be dismissed from a job
Who's next for the chop?
to be likely to be stopped or ended
not much chop
not very good or useful

ex.enText: The dead tree was cut down.

ex.chText: 她开始学习如何使用剪刀裁布。
ex.enText: She began to learn how to cut cloth with scissors.

synonyms.bx: 最普通用词，指用带刃的工具进行切、割、砍等。

ex.enText: He chopped up branches of the tree into firewood.

ex.chText: 你必须把猪肉剁碎后再炖。
ex.enText: You've got to chop up the pork before stewing it.

synonyms.bx: 指用工具将木头劈开或将蔬菜、肉等剁碎。

ex.chText: 他被告知不要砍倒那棵古树。
ex.enText: He was told not to hew down that ancient tree.

synonyms.bx: 指使用切割工具砍、劈大的物体，如石头、树等。

to keep changing your mind or what you are doing
get/be given the chop
to be dismissed from a job

data.enText: The whole department has been given the chop.

data.enText: Three more schemes have got the chop.

to be likely to be dismissed from a job
Who's next for the chop?

not very good or useful
chop (away) at sth
to aim blows at sth with a heavy sharp tool such as an axe
chop sth↔down
to make sth, such as a tree, fall by cutting it at the base with a sharp tool
chop sth↔off (sth)
to remove sth by cutting it with a sharp tool

data.chText: 他从那棵树上砍下一根树枝。
data.enText: He chopped a branch off the tree.
Anne Boleyn had her head chopped off.

tr: a grounder that bounces high in the air
a tennis return made with a downward motion that puts backspin on the ball

example: I'll hit him on the chops

tr: a small cut of meat including part of a rib
the irregular motion of waves (usually caused by wind blowing in a direction opposite to the tide)
example: the boat headed into the chop

tr: strike sharply, as in some sports

example: chop a hole in the ground

value.def: If you chop something, you cut it into pieces with strong downward movements of a knife or an axe.

example.ex: Chop the butter into small pieces...
Visitors were set to work chopping wood.

value.def: A chop is a small piece of meat cut from the ribs of a sheep or pig.
When people chop and change, they keep changing their minds about what to do or how to act.

example.ex: Don't ask me why they have chopped and changed so much.
example.tran: 别问我为什么他们一会儿一个主意。

value.def: If something is for the chop or is going to get the chop, it is going to be stopped or closed. If someone is for the chop, they are going to lose their job or position.

example.ex: He won't say which programmes are for the chop...
example.tran: 他不愿说哪些项目将被毙掉。

example.ex: I was both disappointed and amazed when I got the chop from the Wales team.
example.tran: 我被威尔士队解聘时，既失望又错愕。

value.tran: 将被取消(或关闭);(人)将被解雇
